column4: do you get any error messages , can you post the output from ifconfig(in a console?)
No error messages.  Hold on for the command.
pastebin ;)
Well, I'm chatting from another computer since the system in question doesn't have internet.  Not sure how to go about this other than retyping the output.
got an usb stick? just copy paste the output to a file and copy iut that way?
does it show eth0 or eth1 ?
Yeah, I'll copy it over on a flashdrive.  Hold on. (And thanks.)
if you have a laptop try connecting it to the network connection to make sure its physically fine , im guessing you are using dhcp normally to get an ip?
http://pastebin.com/d44f25ff0
you have an ip there, did you manually set it, can you ping 192.168.1.1 ?
No I didn't manually set it and the ping works fine.
try nslookup www.ubuntu.org
try nslookup www.ubuntu.org
connection timed out, no servers could be reached
cat /etc/resolv.conf
paste the output somewhere?
It's small: domain commspeed.net / search commspeed.net / nameserver 169.254.1.1  (on different lines)
We don't use commspeed anymore though.  Should I change it to my new ISP?
yep
you can set that through network settings though
right click the network icon and choose edit connections etc
Do you know where the field is to change in the network settings?  I'm not fnding it.
under network connections, the wired connection
It only has fields for MAC address and MTU.  No domain or search fields.
